properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 3 at 3:47AM MST until March 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOWS FOR MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS
ABOVE 7,000 FEET TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...

An upper level low tracking across the region will bring a
prolonged period of lowland rains and mountain snows to the
Borderland beginning this morning and ending Wednesday evening.
The heaviest snowfall is expected over the Sacramento Mountains as
snow showers become heavy through the night Tuesday into
Wednesday. New snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches will be
possible for locations above 8000 feet. 2 to 6 inches of snow will
be possible along the east slopes of the Sacramento Mountains.
Further west, snowfall over the Black Range will produce 3 to 5
inches of new snow, and up to 2 to 4 inches in the higher
elevations of the New Mexico Bootheel. Snowfall will end
Wednesday morning over the Black Range, then Wednesday evening
over the Sacramento Mountains.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches
over the Black Range, with isolated higher amounts along the
higher peaks.

* WHERE...Portions of southwest New Mexico within Grant and
Sierra Counties.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to midnight MST Tuesday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT
